greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of distinct orders of primeness among the prime factors of n.
comment: The order of primeness (A078442) of a prime number p is the number of times one must apply A000720 to obtain a nonprime number.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..65536
N. Fernandez, An order of primeness, F(p)
N. Fernandez, An order of primeness [cached copy, included at A006450 with permission of the author]
example: a(105) = 3 because the prime factors of 105 = 3*5*7 have 3 different orders of primeness, namely 2, 3, and 1 respectively.
results.author: _Gus Wiseman_, Nov 24 2018
